item.title: Implementing Custom Aspnet Core ModelBinders
item.description: This post is a summary of a stream I did last night where I implemented all of this. If you want to watch me grumble my way through it, it’s available on YouTube here. In my Crispin project, I wanted the ability to support loading Toggles by both name and ID, for all operations. As I use mediator to send messages from my controllers to the handlers in the domain, this means that I had to either:
